page.topic: Displaying Events on a Calendar Control

section.description: For a visual explanation on how to do this watch this seven part video: [Part 1] [Part 2], [Part 3], [Part 4], [Part 5], [Part 6], [Part 7], or read the guide below.

step.description: In the UX Builder's UX Properties page scroll down to the 'Other' section. Find the 'Date format' property and set it to be 'MM/dd/yyyy'.

section.title: Customize the Layout of the Calendar.

step.description: In the UX Builder on the UX Controls page open the 'Data Controls' menu. Click on the [Calendar] option to add a calendar control to the component. Give the calendar the name 'dt1'.

Highlight the calendar control in the controls tree. In the properties list on the right go to the 'Field Properties' section and set the 'Default value' property to '8/1/1994'. Most of the events listed in the northwinds SQL table that will be used for this example are from 1994.
Go to the 'Date/Time Picker Properties' section. Check the 'Draw boxes around dates' checkbox property.
Set the 'Date item hover class name' property to be 'None' by writing 'None' next to the property.
Set the 'Date item selected calss name' property to be 'None' by writing 'None' next to this property as well.
Set the 'Date item out of range class name' property to be 'hiddenItem'.
Click the [...] button next to the 'Date item style' property.
Scroll down to the 'Positioning and Size' section of the Style Editor. Set the 'Width' and 'Height' properties to be "1.5in". Click OK.
In the calendar's 'Dat/Time Picker Properties' section check the 'Has events' property
Click the '+' button next to the 'Has events' property to expand the events list. Next to the onItemDraw event write 'calendarDrawItem'.
Expand the 'Events' menu and click on the 'Client-side' events page. In the 'Client-Side Events' list highlight the 'onRenderComplete' event.
Add the following function call to the 'onRenderComplete' event.
In the UX Builder's main menu on the left expand the 'Code' menu. Click to open the "Javascript functions" page
Add the following javascript function definitions to the 'Javascript functions' page.
In the 'Code' menu click to open the 'Xbasic functions' page.
In the Xbasic functions page add the following Xbasic function definitions.
step.example:
function getEvents as c (e as p) dim month as c dim year as c dim startDate as d dim endDate as d
startDate = date_value(val(e._year),val(e._month),1) if val(e._month) < 12 then endDate = date_value(val(e._year),val(e._month)+1,1) -1 else endDate = date_value(val(e._year)+1,1,1) -1 end if
dim jsonData as c dim def as p dim defn as p defn.type = "sql" defn.connectionString = "::Name::AADemo-Northwind" defn.tableName = <<%sql% SELECT Orders.OrderID as OrderId, concatenate(orders.orderid,': ', customers.companyname) as eventName, Orders.OrderDate as orderDate, concatenate('Order: ', orders.orderid, ': ', customers.contactname, ' ', customers.companyname) AS eventdescription FROM Orders Orders INNER JOIN Customers Customers ON Orders.CustomerID = Customers.CustomerID %sql%
defn.startDate = year(startDate) + "-" + month(startDate) + "-" + day(startDate) defn.endDate = year(endDate) + "-" + month(endDate) + "-" + day(endDate) defn.eventDate = "orderDate" defn.eventId = "orderId" defn.eventName = "eventName" defn.eventDescription = "eventdescription"
jsonData = a5_GetCalendarEventDataJSON(defn) dim js as c = ""
js = js + "var _cal = {dialog.object}.getControl('DT1');" + crlf() js = js + "_cal._data = " + jsonData + ";" + crlf() js = js + "_cal.refresh();" getEvents = js
end function
